alert.note: Alert for Webster; Wright (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 2:29PM CDT until May 21 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Webster and Wright. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 229 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Myers Branch at Highway ZZ, Pomme De Terre River at Greenwood Road, Panther Creek at Highway B, James River at Bell Ford Road and Cantrell Creek at Scott Creek Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marshfield, Niangua, Rader, Northview and Grovespring. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
